title: Minerals, militants, US-made guns: Why Trump’s bet on Munir is set to fail
content: A recent mosque bombing in Islamabad highlights Pakistan's security challenges, even as its generals offer Washington access to vast mineral wealth. Insurgents, armed with US-made weapons left in Afghanistan, threaten critical mining projects in Balochistan, complicating Pakistan's strategic mineral diplomacy and its balancing act between China and the US.

title: Delhi Police register FIR over circulation of ex-Army chief Naravane's unpublished book
content: Rahul Gandhi's insistence on reading purported extracts from the yet-to-be-published Naravane's book shone the spotlight on the rules and regulations that restrict senior military officials from revealing classified information or crucial leadership decisions even after retirement. The book was slated to hit the stands in January 2024, but the Army and the defence ministry asked the publisher not to go ahead until they had reviewed its contents.

title: Russian crude imports to be cut by half? India lays out approach amid trade deal with US
content: On its part the Trump administration has claimed that India has committed to ending both direct and indirect imports of oil from the Russian Federation. The executive order by Trump says that the tariffs on Indian exports to the US could be increased if such crude imports resume.

title: Watch: Armenia ups defence, shows off Indian Akash SAMs, Pinaka
content: Armenia has showcased new Indian-made weapons, including Akash missile systems and Pinaka rocket launchers, marking a significant step in its defence ties with New Delhi. This move signifies Armenia's diversification of arms procurement, seeking alternatives to Soviet and Russian equipment. The deal, valued at $250 million, underscores India's growing role as a defence exporter.

title: Microsoft appoints its first 'Engineering Quality Head,' and here's why that matters
content: Microsoft has appointed Charlie Bell, its former security chief, as the company's new engineering quality head — less than a year after CEO Satya Nadella said AI writes 30% of its code. The move comes amid rising Windows 11 bugs, underwhelming Copilot adoption, and growing evidence that AI-generated code introduces more errors than it eliminates.

title: 'Stop the lip service': Ex-India cricketer's blunt message after Nepal stun the T20 WC
content: Former India batter Aakash Chopra urged the ICC and top nations to offer sustained opportunities to associate teams like Nepal, citing their thrilling T20 World Cup 2026 performance against England. He criticized token participation, emphasizing that genuine growth requires regular bilateral series and tournaments, not just fleeting applause after major events.

title: Punjab campus horror: Law student kills girl classmate, then turns gun on himself
content: A shocking murder-suicide unfolded at Usma Law College in Tarn Taran, where a first-year student fatally shot her classmate before taking his own life. Both students, Sandeep Kaur and Prince Raj Singh, were in their first semester. Authorities are investigating the motive, reviewing CCTV footage and witness statements to understand the tragic incident that has left the campus reeling.

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
content: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." Employees seek transparency on contracts, a Q&A session, and protection for all workers, calling for an end to complicity in government actions.

title: Japan’s ‘Iron Lady’ Takaichi upends Asia’s power math: And the winner is India
content: Japan's Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi secured a powerful mandate, winning a landslide victory. This political stability empowers Tokyo to significantly reshape its approach to China, strengthen ties with the US, and deepen strategic partnerships with India.  Her decisive win signals a more assertive Japan on the global stage, impacting regional dynamics.

title: 'Won't allow any impediment in SIR': SC's clear message to states on Mamata's plea
content: The Supreme Court has stated it will not permit any obstacles in the ongoing special intensive revision of electoral rolls across states. This comes as West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee filed a petition challenging the revision process in her poll-bound state.

title: Taiwan VP dismisses plans to bring chips back to US: I have made it very clear
content: Taiwan's Vice Premier has firmly stated that relocating 40% of the island's semiconductor capacity to the US is "impossible." While Taiwan is open to expanding its presence and sharing expertise in the US, its core semiconductor ecosystem will remain firmly rooted and continue to grow domestically. This response counters recent US calls for a significant shift in chip production.

title: No ecosystem in India: How 9-yo Arshi became youngest to join F1 programme
content: Arshi Gupta, a 9-year-old from Faridabad, became the youngest driver selected for the F1 Academy’s Discover Your Drive (DYD) programme. Noticing her early love for speed, her father guided her into karting, leading to international training and wins in the UAE, UK, and India. Her journey highlights not only her exceptional talent but also India’s limited motorsport infrastructure.

title: Pvt players or HAL? Who will build India's 5th gen stealth jet AMCA - explained
content: India's ambitious Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA) project is reportedly excluding Hindustan Aeronautics Limited from its development phase, signaling a potential shift towards private industry leadership. This move, amid HAL's existing commitments and Tejas Mk-1A delays, aims to accelerate the development of the indigenous fifth-generation stealth fighter.

title: 'BJP may even give Bharat Ratna to Godse': Owaisi slams RSS chief's Savarkar remarks
content: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi criticized the BJP and RSS for advocating the Bharat Ratna for V.D. Savarkar, suggesting they might even award it to Mahatma Gandhi's assassin, Nathuram Godse. Owaisi cited the J.L. Kapur Commission report, which identified Savarkar as a conspirator in Gandhi's assassination, and highlighted Maulvi Alauddin as the first prisoner at Cellular Jail, not an RSS member.

title: NBA trade rumors: Lakers eye $186m Bucks star to join LeBron & Doncic
content: Trade speculation is intensifying around the Lakers potentially acquiring Giannis Antetokounmpo in the 2026 offseason. A hypothetical framework involves a package of Austin Reaves, Rui Hachimura, Dalton Knecht, Adou Thiero, and multiple future draft picks. This move would create a star-studded trio with LeBron James and Luka Dončić, aiming for immediate championship contention.

title: RSS chief calls Salman Khan inspiration; Farhan Akhtar seeks Rs 40 cr from Ranveer – Top 5 entertainment news
content: Salman Khan reacted positively after RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat called him an inspiration for college students. Meanwhile, 'Krrish 4' faces a delay due to budget disagreements between Hrithik Roshan and Aditya Chopra.  Additionally, Farhan Akhtar's production house is reportedly demanding Rs 40 crore from Ranveer Singh.

title: 'Staff kept incident hidden for hrs': Newborn charred to death in Kanpur hospital fire
content: A newborn girl tragically perished in a fire that erupted in the NICU of Raja Hospital in Kanpur's Bithoor area. The blaze, reportedly caused by a short circuit, engulfed the infant's bed. Hospital staff allegedly concealed the incident for hours before the distressed parents were informed, leading to a chaotic scene and police intervention.

title: Watergate revelations: Nixon asked China to interfere in India-Pak 1971 War
content: In his grand jury testimony, Nixon described a secret assurance given to Beijing during the war. His full statement reads: “The Russians were supporting India. … Nobody was supporting Pakistan because there was an embargo on the shipment of arms. … But we were giving moral support to them, and also we gave to the Chinese an assurance privately that if India jumped Pakistan and China decided to take on the Indians that we would support them.”

title: Jana Nayagan censor row: Madras HC to hear Vijay starrer case on February 10
content: Thalapathy Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan' censor row is nearing an end as the producers have withdrawn their legal battle. The Madras High Court will hear the case for withdrawal on February 10, 2026. This move allows the film's certification process to proceed with the revising committee, potentially paving the way for its delayed release.

title: ‘Maoism never helped any society’: Shah urges Naxalites to surrender
content: Union home minister Amit Shah declared Maoism's destructive nature, vowing its complete elimination from India by March 31. He urged Naxalites to surrender for rehabilitation, highlighting Chhattisgarh's attractive policy. Shah emphasized development initiatives transforming Bastar, promising significant progress in infrastructure and economic opportunities for tribal communities.

title: T20 WC: Zimbabwe kickstart campaign with dominant win over Oman
content: Zimbabwe dominated Oman in their T20 World Cup match, winning by eight wickets. Fast bowlers Blessing Muzarabani, Richard Ngarava, and Brad Evans dismantled Oman’s batting to limit them to 103 runs. In reply, Brian Bennett’s unbeaten 48 and Brendan Taylor’s 31 guided Zimbabwe to a comfortable chase in just over 13 overs. The win highlighted Zimbabwe’s strong bowling attack and Bennett’s excellent form.

title: Travis Kelce felt 'awkward' with Blake Lively & Ryan Reynolds, reports say
content: As Taylor Swift deals with probably being called to court after her controversial text exchange with Blake Lively was made public, it seems Travis Kelce was never fond of their company. Just a few hours ago, an insider has claimed that Travis Kelce reportedly felt uncomfortable while hanging out with the Hollywood power couple and is now pretty concerned about Taylor Swift.

title: Lamborghini crash Kanpur: All you need to know about this Rs 10 Cr supercar
content: A rare Lamborghini Revuelto, valued at Rs 10 crore, was seized by Kanpur police after a crash. This exclusive supercar, launched in India in December 2023, boasts a powerful V12 engine combined with a plug-in hybrid system, delivering over 1,000 hp.  The model is sold out globally until 2026, making its presence on Indian roads exceptionally limited.

title: KL Rahul's century sinks 42-time champions Mumbai, Karnataka enter Ranji's semis
content: KL Rahul scored a brilliant century to lead Karnataka to a four-wicket victory against Mumbai. This win secured Karnataka's place in the Ranji Trophy semifinals. Rahul's 130 runs were crucial in chasing down the target. Ravichandran Smaran also played a vital role with an unbeaten 83. Karnataka will now face Uttarakhand in the next round.

title: 'Very balanced order': SC upholds Madras high court's deepam nod at Madurai hilltop
content: ​​A bench comprising Justice Aravind Kumar and Justice PB Varale declined to interfere, describing the high court order as balanced. Appearing for the petitioner, Advocate Prashant Bhushan submitted that there has never been a law and order problem in the area. ​​"It seems to be a very very balanced order," Justice Kumar said and Justice Varale agreed with it.

title: Laine trade rumors heat up as Canadiens, Red Wings discuss deadline
content: The name of Patrik Laine has been mentioned in NHL trade rumors with the Montreal Canadiens supposedly looking at possible acquisitions of the old-time winger. The Detroit Red Wings are considered a potential destination due to the needs on the roster and the cap space. The history of injury, the structure of the contracts, and the playoffs will probably influence the negotiations as the teams will keep a closer eye on Laine and track his situation before the NHL trade deadline.

title: After losing historic opening match, Italy hit with more bad news
content: Italy captain Wayne Madsen is likely to miss the rest of the T20 World Cup league stage after dislocating his shoulder while fielding against Scotland. Coach John Davison said scans will determine his return but called it “doubtful.” Despite the setback, Italy showed fight in the chase, and Davison hopes Madsen can still travel with the team and help as part of the coaching staff.

title: Exclusive: I was trying to click the Tsunami ride at Surajkund Mela and it came crashing down
content: The Surajkund International Crafts Mela, a vibrant annual event, was marred by a tragic accident when a swing ride collapsed, injuring 13 people and claiming the life of an SHO who rushed to help. The incident starkly contrasted the festive atmosphere, highlighting the fragile line between celebration and disaster.

title: 6 hurt as Lamborghini rams auto, bike in Kanpur; tycoon's son named in FIR
content: Recalling the horror, the eyewitnesses told news agency PTI that the car first hit an autorickshaw and then crashed into a stationary motorcycle, flinging its rider nearly 10 feet into the air. The car mounted the motorcycle's front wheel and dragged it for some distance before hitting an electric pole and coming to a halt.

title: 3 wives, 1 dead live-in partner, 3 dead daughters: Ghaziabad suicide case reveals grim past
content: Three minor sisters tragically ended their lives in Ghaziabad, leaping from their ninth-floor apartment. Investigations revealed a complex family dynamic, with the girls deeply engrossed in Korean culture. Their diary entries suggest intense frustration over parental opposition to their interests and a profound sense of isolation, hinting at a desperate cry for understanding.

title: Assam CM 'point-bank' video row: Owaisi files compaint, calls it 'genocidal hate speech'
content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi has lodged a formal complaint with Hyderabad police. He seeks criminal action against Assam chief minister Himanta Biswa Sarma. This is over a now-deleted video allegedly showing Sarma shooting at Muslims. Owaisi stated genocidal hate speech has become a norm. The complaint cites Sarma's repeated statements targeting the Muslim community.

title: NCP(SP) chief Sharad Pawar hospitalised in Pune after health concerns
content: Veteran leader Sharad Pawar was admitted to a Pune hospital after experiencing a persistent cough and breathing difficulties. Doctors confirmed a chest infection following a CT scan. Accompanied by his daughter Supriya Sule, the 85-year-old leader is under close medical observation, with further treatment decisions pending test results.

title: ‘Lost a bit of power’: Ponting, Shastri on why Babar stands at a crossroads
content: Ricky Ponting and Ravi Shastri are questioning Pakistan's approach to Babar Azam at the T20 World Cup, citing his slow starts and perceived loss of power. Experts suggest a more aggressive batting style and potentially a change in batting order to alleviate pressure on the star batter.

title: 'Krrish 4' stalled as Hrithik Roshan and Aditya Chopra at odds over Rs 500 crore budget - Reports
content: Fans face a delay for 'Krrish 4' as Hrithik Roshan and producer Aditya Chopra clash over a Rs. 500 crore budget versus Rs. 350 crore. Hrithik, also directing, aims for international superhero standards, while Chopra prioritizes commercial viability. The project is on hold, with Hrithik exploring other studios and script revisions. Priyanka Chopra Jonas is reportedly returning.

title: 'My wife visited Pak for work-related purpose': Gaurav Gogoi on Assam CM's allegations
content: Assam Congress chief Gaurav Gogoi has strongly denied allegations made by Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma linking him to Pakistan. Gogoi called the claims false and demanded the immediate release of an SIT report to prove his innocence. He accused the Chief Minister of targeting his family and a community.

title: What are Tier-2 cities and why they’re hotspots for real estate investment
content: India's real estate is booming, with Tier 2 cities emerging as key investment hubs. Driven by improved infrastructure, enhanced liveability, and stable growth, these mid-sized urban centers offer affordable living and rising property values. Developers are increasingly investing here, signaling a shift towards more predictable, end-user-focused markets offering a better quality of life.

title: Unnao rape case: SC rejects Kuldeep Sengar’s bail plea, asks HC for ‘out of turn’ hearing
content: The Supreme Court has directed the Delhi High Court to expedite the hearing of former BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar's plea for bail and suspension of sentence in the Unnao rape victim's father's custodial death case. This comes after the High Court previously denied him bail in the matter, which stems from a 2018 FIR.

title: IT stock crash! Rs 2.5 lakh crore erased in 3 Days — What should investors do?
content: Indian IT shares have plummeted, losing Rs 2.5 lakh crore as AI automation threatens traditional outsourcing. New tools from Anthropic and Palantir, capable of rapid SAP migrations, have spooked investors. Analysts predict a significant revenue hit, though historical disruptions have ultimately spurred industry growth. Investors are now cautiously assessing the sector's AI-driven future.

title: Keir Starmer out, Shabana Mahmood in? How Epstein files could lead to UK's first Muslim PM
content: Starmer is not accused of misconduct, and Mandelson has consistently denied any impropriety. Yet British politics does not operate solely on legal thresholds. It operates on perception, timing and instinct. The renewed attention on Epstein has revived a broader unease about elite networks, proximity to power and the sense that some figures are insulated from consequences. In that climate, Mandelson’s return has become a liability rather than an asset, raising uncomfortable questions not about guilt, but about judgement.

title: 3BHK Flat, But 9 Slept In One Room: New Details In Ghaziabad Triple Suicide
content: Multiple marriages, five children crammed in a single room, a mysterious 2018 death, and financial ruin - the triple suicide of three sisters in Ghaziabad reeks of buried horrors.

title: 7-Year-Old Tibetan Girl Raped In Odisha, Minor Detained: Police
content: A seven-year-old Tibetan girl was allegedly raped in Odisha's Gajapati district on Monday, police said.

title: Rapid Action Battalion: Inside Bangladesh's Elite Force Accused Of War Crimes
content: With Bangladesh's general elections scheduled for February 12, the Rapid Action Battalion (RAB) is once again under international scrutiny.

title: Top Court Directs Centre To Frame SOP To Deal With 'Digital Arrest' Scams
content: The Supreme Court on Monday described the siphoning of over Rs 54,000 crore by digital frauds as absolute "robbery or dacoity" and asked the Centre to draft a standard operating procedure in consultation with stakeholders like the RBI, banks.

title: UP Boy, 16, Killed After Being Hit By Vande Bharat Express
content: A 16-year-old boy died after being hit by the Vande Bharat Express here, with his family members booked for vandalising the hospital where he was admitted, an official said on Monday.

title: Sharad Pawar Admitted To Pune Hospital After Breathing Trouble
content: NCP (SP) chief Sharad Pawar was on Monday brought to a private hospital in Pune from his residence in Baramati after complaints of cough and difficulty in breathing.

title: UP Woman's Body On Road Inside Blanket. AI Leads To Live-In Partner's Arrest
content: A woman's body, wrapped in a blanket and left on the side of the Yamuna Expressway in Agra, triggered a 24-hour investigation that relied not only on conventional policing but also on artificial intelligence (AI).

title: Pak Leader's Fiery Jab At Country's Military With A 'Pomegranate' Example
content: Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam (F) chief Maulana Fazlur Rehman accused the Shehbaz-Sharif-led Pakistani government of failing in its foreign policy.

title: "Outright Lies": China Rejects US Claims Of Secret Nuclear Tests
content: China on Monday denied US allegations it had conducted secret nuclear explosive tests, calling them "outright lies" and accusing Washington of making excuses to start up its own trials.

title: Tajuddin Ahmad Was Bangladesh's First PM. How He Was Killed Inside A Prison
content: Tajuddin Ahmad, the first Prime Minister of Bangladesh and one of the country's most important leaders during the Liberation War, was brutally killed inside Dhaka Central Jail on November 3, 1975.

title: 6-Year-old Girl Raped, Murdered By Neighbour In Bihar
content: A six-year-old girl was allegedly raped and murdered by her 22-year-old neighbour in Bihar's Darbhanga district.

title: "Won't Allow Any Impediment To SIR Process," Supreme Court Warns States
content: The Supreme Court today delivered a strong message to all state governments: the process of Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls cannot be obstructed. The top court also extended the deadline for SIR in West Bengal by one more week.

title: SIR Hearing Live Updates - Supreme Court Issues Showcause Notice To Bengal Top Cop
content: Bengal SIR Hearing Live Updates: The Supreme Court is hearing the Election Commission's reply to West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's petition challenging the special intensive revision (SIR) in the state.

title: "Balanced Order": Top Court On Madras High Court's Verdict On Deepam Row
content: The Supreme Court has refused to hear a petition against an order of the Madras High Court, limiting Muslims' worship at Tamil Nadu's Thirupparankundram hills.

title: Police Crackdown Near Kochi After Locals Protest Over Drugs, Migrants Issue
content: Mounting tensions between local residents and Bengali migrant workers in Perumbavoor, a key industrial hub in the suburbs of Kochi, have triggered an extensive police crackdown.

title: New Photos Link Former Kerala Minister to Sabarimala Gold Theft Accused
content: A fresh controversy has broken out in the Sabarimala gold theft case after a new photograph emerged showing former Devaswom Minister Kadakampally Surendran with the prime accused, Unnikrishnan Potti, who was recently released on bail.

title: Car Door Flew 100 Metres Away After Delhi Red Fort Blast
content: The force of the explosion that killed eight people and injured 24 this evening near Delhi's historic Red Fortwas so powerful that the door of a car was flung nearly 100 metres from the blast site, officials said.

title: Aviation Ministry To Inspect Uncontrolled Airfields After Ajit Pawar Crash: Sources
content: Following the death of Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and four others in a crash at the uncontrolled Baramati airfield last month, the Ministry of Civil Aviation has rolled out an inspection of uncontrolled airstrips.

title: Files Show Ex-Prince Andrew May Have Passed Confidential Reports To Epstein
content: Ex-prince Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor may have passed potentially confidential reports to Jeffrey Epstein while a UK trade envoy, according to US government files on the late US sex offender released last month.

title: Actor, Not Child Detained By ICE Agents, Was Bad Bunny's Super Bowl Guest
content: Music superstar Bad Bunny paused mid-performance during his historic Super Bowl LX halftime show to hand one of his Grammy Awards to a young boy.

title: Joseph hints at willingness to negotiate with the Congress over seat allotments
content: KC chairperson says during negotiations with Congress, some changes regarding seat-sharing may occur. Statement comes amid months of mounting pressure from Congress workers to reclaim Idukki seat

title: International Kite Festival concludes on a colourful note in Hubballi
content: On both February 7 and 8 night, the evening sky lit up with LED kites, creating a magical atmosphere and attracting a large audience to the cultural activities.

title: Former revenue inspector sentenced to seven years in bribery case
content: He was found guilty of accepting a bribe of ₹2,000 from a complainant for issuing an ownership certificate

title: Enforce UGC equity norms in higher educational institutions: Karnataka Dalit Sangharsh Samiti
content: The body criticises the Supreme Court’s interim stay on the enforcement, calling it a serious setback for social justice.

title: CM’s chopper lands on different helipad; miscommunication the reason, say police sources
content: Instead of landing the Chief Minister’s helicopter on a helipad near Raichur road, the pilot landed it on the helipad near Kalaburagi Road.

title: Bihar Government says will probe into foreigners’ visit to Gopalganj during 1990-2015; Opposition protests over ‘deteriorating’ law and order situation
content: Deputy Chief Minister Samrat Choudhary says out of total 173 foreign nationals who visited the district during 1990-2015, 168 were from Pakistan. Opposition members protest over issues such as deteriorating law and order situation, surge in rape and death cases, and arrest of Pappu Yadav

title: IIT Madras launches Bachelor of Science in Aeronautics and Space Tech
content: Students who have passed Class XII or equivalent, or diploma holders may join, since there is no cap on enrolment or a requirement for IIT-JEE qualification

title: Assembly panel for extending Student Police Cadet programme to all schools to prevent substance abuse
content: Assembly Committee on Welfare of Women, Transgenders, Children, and Differently Abled wants counsellors to be deployed in all government, aided, and private schools

title: Sreelekha courts controversy after staying away from BJP councillors’ Delhi trip
content: The BJP councillors of the Thiruvananthapuram Corporation, accompanied by State and district leaders of the party, embarked on the trip to participate in a reception to be accorded to them by Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Council poll: Limbikai urges graduates to register as voters
content: He says several applications are being rejected owing to incomplete details and documentation issues.

title: Congress seeks answers over ‘missing’ Epstein files
content: Opposition party asks if the India-U.S. trade deal is the price to be paid to make ‘scandalous material disappear’

title: As LDF rally reaches Pala, old rivals trade blows
content: Mani accuses Kappan of neglecting unfinished projects, claiming most development in Pala occurred under the late K.M. Mani. In turn, Kappan alleges that Mani sought favours from rival parties and hindered key initiatives. The potential entry of BJP State vice-president Shaun George in the election fray could intensify the competition.

title: BJP leaders insulting Telangana keeping quiet on Centre’s discrimination: Revanth
content: Chief Minister says no project in Telangana has received national status, no special grants have been sanctioned for the Musi river, Metro Rail or the Sammakka–Saralamma Jatara, and major initiatives such as ITIR and semiconductor projects have been denied to the State

title: ED summons West Bengal police official for questioning in coal smuggling case
content: Manoranjan Mondal, the in-charge of Budbud police station in the district, was summoned days after the Central probe agency conducted searches at his residence, during which several documents were seized

title: Trade unions call for strike on February 12
content: Trade unions want the government to repeal the four labour codes and withdraw several proposed and existing policies affecting workers and farmers.

title: Canada Indian shooting: Parents had wanted victim to return home
content: "We had never expected this, not even in our dreams. We had been telling him to come back as it has been six to seven years since he left for Canada but he did not listen to us," says Chandan Kumar’s father Nanda Kumar

title: Godrej Agrovet launches new insecticide TAKAI for rice crops
content: Powered by CyclaprynTM technology, it delivers rapid feeding cessation and sustained pest control over a longer duration, says Godrej Agrovet (Crop Protection Business) CEO

title: Kannada Bhavan blueprint under preparation: DC
content: The facility proposed in memory of the successful conduct of the 87th Kannada Sahitya Sammelana is coming up in Mandya at a cost of Rs 5.50 crore. The foundation stone for the building was laid on January 30

title: Sharad Pawar hospitalised in Pune due to chest congestion, exertion
content: Doctors say Mr. Pawar’s condition is stable, and that he has been admitted to a private room, and not the intensive care unit (ICU); grand-nephew Rohit Pawar appeals to party workers ‘not to make a beeline to the hospital’

title: Food poisoning at Devarapalli ashram school: 35 students discharged
content: Ten students remain under medical observation and the Tribal Welfare Department In-charge Director to submit a ground-level report to higher authorities

title: Bird flu situation under control in A.P., says Agriculture Minister Atchnnaidu
content: Additional samples gathered from Sodam and Karvetinagaram have been sent to laboratory Bhopal for testing, says Atchannaidu

title: Discarded Fishnet Collection Centres to come up in coastal districts of the central region
content: Sites identified for the centres will come up in four coastal districts of Pudukottai, Nagapattinam, Tiruvarur and Thanjavur under the TN-SHORE Project to tackle marine litter and recycle the discarded nets

title: Bird flu containment operations in full swing in Annamayya, Chittoor
content: Poultry farms have been told to adhere to biosecurity norms, restrict entry of outsiders and vehicles, and report any abnormal bird deaths or respiratory symptoms such as nasal discharge or gasping

title: Gujarat exchanges Letter of Intent with Starlink for high-speed internet connectivity
content: The aim is to provide high-speed satellite-based internet connectivity in the State's remote, border, and underserved areas that currently have limited telecom infrastructure, the release said, adding it is part of the Digital Connectivity Mission and other strategic initiatives

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Opposition walks out of Rajya Sabha
content: They continue to protest, accusing the government of not letting Lok Sabha Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi speak in the House.

title: Indian-Canadian man shot dead in Toronto parking lot
content: The victim, Nandakumar, originally from Karnataka, was an IT professional in Canada; the shooting marks Toronto’s third homicide of the year

title: Bengal BJP demands death penalty for Trinamool leader arrested for murder
content: The Trinamool Congress councillor in Bengal’s Barrackpore allegedly assaulted an 80-year-old man who was protesting against an illegal construction outside his house; the elderly man died on the spot

title: One year on, ASHA workers in Karnataka await promised honorarium; to strike again on February 12
content: The ASHA Workers’ Union has been seeking a fixed monthly honorarium of ₹15,000, along with an additional ₹2,000 for city-based workers. A ₹10,000 fixed honorarium, however, was reiterated by CM Siddaramaiah on January 11, 2025.

title: Pandemonium in J&K Assembly over SASCI; BJP walks out alleging unfairness
content: PDP MLA Para accused the ruling dispensation of pushing Jammu and Kashmir into a debt trap with the SASCI scheme; cautions CM that J&K should not be pushed towards a situation similar to that faced by “failed states like Sri Lanka and Pakistan”

title: New dragonfly species discovered in Kerala, named Lyriothemis keralensis
content: Although the species has been known to be found in Kerala since 2013, it had remained misidentified for over a decade as Lyriothemis acigastra, a species previously though to be restricted to northeast India

title: Long way to achieve complete equality for girl children: Calcutta High Court's Port Blair Bench
content: The Port Blair sessions court had discharged the woman’s in-laws, accused of torturing her and demanding dowry from her parents, especially after she gave birth to a girl child. She killed her daughter and herself in 2021.

title: Government, Opposition lock horns in Lok Sabha, leading to repeated adjournments
content: The Lok Sabha proceedings were adjourned twice earlier – once at 11 a.m. when the business of the day began and again after a few minutes of proceedings at 12 noon

title: Police head constable suspended over viral video of him abusing workers at Erode eatery
content: CCTV footage shows the constable damaging items in the shop, using abusive language, and attempting to assault the workers

title: Asaduddin Owaisi filed complains against Assam Chief Minister over alleged hate speech video
content: In the complaint, Mr. Owaisi alleged that Himanta Biswa Sarma had, over several years, made statements against the Muslim community through social media, print media and public speeches

title: DMK MP Tiruchi Siva moves privilege notice against Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal
content: Siva contends that Mr. Goyal held a press conference on the Indo-US trade deal before briefing Parliament. When Parliament is in session, all executive decisions have to be shared with Parliament before going to press.

title: Jana Nayagan producer to withdraw writ petition from Madras High Court
content: The writ petition is expected to be listed under the caption ‘For Withdrawal’ before Justice P.T. Asha on Tuesday since KVN Productions LLP has agreed for the reference to the revising committee

title: BJP believes in nation first, Opposition in self-interest first, feels party chief Nitin Nabin
content: In his first visit to his home State of Bihar since becoming BJP chief, Mr. Nabin says he got the opportunity to visit States like Kerala and West Bengal, ‘where party workers are making sacrifices, without worrying about what they are going to get in return’

title: Karnataka Home Minister calls meeting on Feb 11 to review progress of safety measures by KSCA at Bengaluru’s Chinnaswamy stadium
content: Delegation meets Minister requesting clearances for inclusion of Bengaluru in the schedule for international cricket matches and the IPL tournament

title: In Pictures: Inside Tata Motors-Jaguar Land Rover manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu
content: Images from the Tata Motors-Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) plant established in Tamil Nadu. The luxury car manufacturing facility was opened on February 9, 2026

title: Kerala Public Expenditure Review Committee calls for revenue boost, spending rationalisation for long-term growth
content: First report of 7th KPERC, for the period 2021-22 to 2023-24, observes that Kerala is operating in ‘an increasingly constrained and less-than-supportive Centre-State fiscal environment’

title: PM did not come to Lok Sabha fearing not because of threat from MPs: Rahul Gandhi
content: Rahul Gandhi said the government is scared of having a discussion on the Budget because of the issue of the U.S. deal, the way it was done, and its impact on farmers

title: Punjab law college student kills woman classmate inside classroom, shoots self
content: CCTV footage from the classroom shows the first-year law student getting up from a bench and shooting his classmate in the head before turning the gun on himself

content: In the early hours of Sunday (February 8, 2026), Mahesh, 28, of Karalavadi village was trampled to death by a herd of elephants while attempting, along with other farmers, to drive them away from agricultural fields

title: SC terms siphoning of over ₹54,000 cr by digital fraud ‘dacoity’, asks Centre to frame SoP
content: The Bench has also noted that the RBI has crafted an SOP prescribing action by the banks to temporarily hold debit cards to prevent cyber-enabled fraud.

title: Watch: Surajkund swing collapse: Family mourns death of Haryana police inspector

title: Seahawks' Walker, 'one of one,' earns MVP honors
content: Buoyed by a first-half surge in which he outgained the entire Patriots offense, Seahawks running back Kenneth Walker III, a pending unrestricted free agent, earned MVP honors as Seattle ran to a 29-13 victory Sunday.

title: Maye: Had injection for ailing shoulder before loss
content: Patriots QB Drake Maye acknowledged he received a pain-killing injection for his injured right throwing shoulder before Sunday's loss, but maintained he was "good to go" for the game and just didn't make enough plays in the end.

title: Olympics seek solution to rash of broken medals
content: Handle with care. That's the message from gold medalist Breezy Johnson at the Winter Olympics after she and other athletes found their medals broke within hours.

content: The Pirates have agreed to a one-year, $12 million deal with veteran slugger Marcell Ozuna, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Kubiak confirms he's taking Raiders' coaching job
content: Seahawks OC Klint Kubiak confirmed on NFL Network following the team's Super Bowl win over the Patriots on Sunday night that he will be leaving Seattle to take over as coach of the Raiders.

title: Seahawks, Rams favored in wide-open SB LXI field
content: The Seahawks are tied with the Rams at +950 to win Super Bowl LXI, followed by the Bills at +1100, and the Eagles, Ravens and Patriots tied at +1300, according to DraftKings odds.

title: Darnold perseveres through injury, doubt in SB win

title: See the Seahawks stop the run and win the Super Bowl
content: The defense doesn't often take center stage in the Super Bowl, but the  Seattle Seahawks ' unit took over in its  29-13 win  against the  New England Patriots . The Patriots were scoreless in their 10 possessions of the game, tying the Colts (Super Bowl III) for the fourth-longest drought to begin a Super Bowl, according to Elias Sports Bureau. The Seahawks' defense held the Patriots to four first downs, 51 total yards, 2.0 yards per play and three sacks in the first half. We captured the plays that secured the Seahawks their second Super Bowl win.
